Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: https://www.eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/release/6-29-10.cfm
Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of San Diego

Info Source: https://www.thefreelibrary.com/PETCO+Agrees+To+Settle+California+Employee+Overtime+Litigation.-a095384071
Notes: The company also reported the settlement in an SEC filing: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/888455/000104746903009323/a2104702z10-k.htm#toc_dg1091_2

Description: The U.S. Department of Justice and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced a settlement agreement with Anchor Glass Container Corporation to resolve alleged Clean Air Act violations at all six of Anchor's container glass manufacturing facilities located in Florida, Georgia, Indiana, Minnesota, New York and Oklahoma and improve the company's compliance with federal and state clean air laws.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/enforcement/anchor-glass-container-corporation-clean-air-act-settlement

Description: Plaintiffs alleged that Petco obtained and reviewed consumer reports detailing the financial histories of job applicants  without first providing the notice required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act.
Private Litigation Case Title: Feist et al v. Petco Animal Supplies, Inc. et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1103458/petco-s-1-2m-deal-to-end-hidden-credit-check-case-ok-d

Description: Anchor Glass agreed to pay a total of $550,000 to Indiana and Oklahoma to resolve Clean Air Act violations. This was part of a larger $1.1 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-anchor-glass-container-corporation
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/enforcement/anchor-glass-container-corporation-clean-air-act-settlement

Description: PETCO agreed to pay $1.75 million in settlement of allegations by five California District Attorneys and the City Attorney of San Diego that it overcharged customers and failed to properly care for animals.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20110309090558/http://da.co.la.ca.us/mr/060210d.htm

Description: PETCO agreed to pay $854,254 in settlement of allegations by four California District Attorneys that it overcharged customers and failed to properly care for animals.

https://www.sfcityattorney.org/2004/05/27/herrera-obtains-unprecedented-injunctions-against-petco-on-animal-conditions-in-city-stores/
